department: Department of Public Works and Government Services
short_summary: Decommissioning of Land Treatment Unit in Cambridge Bay, Nunavut, including Infrastructure and Equipment.
description: Decommissioning/Remediation project in Cambridge Bay, Nunavut. Construction/remediation works must start by June 2024 and must be completed by September 2024. The contract completion end date for submittals is December 31, 2024.
full_summary:
================================
* EW699-241903 Advance Notice to Industry: Land Treatment Unit Decommissioning and Remediation Project Cambridge Bay
* Préavis à l'industrie : Projet de mise hors service et d'assainissement de l'unité de traitement de sol Cambridge Bay
* Solicitation Number: WS4447206800
* Notice Date: 2024-02-16
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-03-29T14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-06-28
*

**Background Information**

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) intends to invite registered Inuit Firms on the Inuit Firm Registry to bid on a Decommissioning/Remediation project in Cambridge Bay, Nunavut. This project involves the decommissioning and remediation of a land treatment unit, and PSPC is finalizing the tender documents.

**Project Details**

* Location: Cambridge Bay, Nunavut Territory
* Services: Non-residential building construction services, specialized trade construction and maintenance services
* Objectives: Decommissioning and remediation of a land treatment unit, with construction/ remediation works starting by end of June 2024 and completion by end of September 2024

**Procurement Information**

* Procurement Category: Construction
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Selective tendering
* Notice Type: Request for Proposal (RFP)
* Selection Criteria: Highest combined rating of technical merit and price
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Contact Information**

* Nafissa Diop, PSPC Contact: nafissa.diop@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
* This notice is not a solicitation. The RFP will be available through Canadabuys (SAP Ariba) by April 10, 2024.

**Action Required**

If you believe your firm or an associated joint venture may be qualified and capable of undertaking this project, please respond to this notice at the above contact email address to indicate your interest in participating in the upcoming RFP.

**Language of the RFP**

English and French.

Note: The RFP will be available in English and French and respondents are expected to submit their proposals in both languages.
=============================================

Total Characters: 341. <sup>1</sup> Honestly, I thought you would not be able to handle rewriting of the document in a more professional manner. WELL
